profileAlternative.name: Thomas Dietert
profileAlternative.headline: Compiler Engineer at Groq
profileAlternative.summary:
I am currently interested in Programming Languages and the theory behind building secure and robust software systems. I am a lover of functional programming and feel that declarative programming paradigms will play a crucial role in the next few decades of software development.

If you are interested in any open source projects I am working on, when I find the time, check out my github profile: https://github.com/tdietert

aboutAlternative.text:
I am currently interested in Programming Languages and the theory behind building secure and robust software systems. I am a lover of functional programming and feel that declarative programming paradigms will play a crucial role in the next few decades of software development.

If you are interested in any open source projects I am working on, when I find the time, check out my github profile: https://github.com/tdietert

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description: Designed and implemented a Distributed Ledge Technology "Uplink", along with a smart contract programming language for facilitating complex multi-party work-flows targeting the Uplink data model. Implemented consensus, networking, and cryptographic protocols based on seminal papers in the respective research domains.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description: Full stack software development in Haskell. Designed and implemented an image analysis and prediction web application using bespoke, sophisticated ML models with techniques such as Function Reactive Programming (FRP), the GHCJS compiler. Designed Postgres DB schemas and data acquisition layers and web servers delivering data to frontend data analysis tooling.

positions.title: Virtual Platform Engineering Intern
positions.description: Worked on a team of interns to develop both the frontend and backend of a virtual network testbed creation automation tool to improve the build time of internal computing resources on the cloud.

positions.title: Computer Vision Research Assistant
positions.description: Helped a PhD candidate in creating ground truths for sophisticated machine learning algorithms using Pattern theory to extract features of video and audio clips to construct meaningful interpretations of the action being performed.

positions.title: Junior Software Developer
positions.description: Web Design on the Microsoft Stack, ASP.net.

items: Genetic Algorithm for TSP using CUDA

peopleAlsoViewed.text: Chief of Staff to CEO & Head of Strategic Operations
Summer Technology Analyst Intern - Application Developer at JPMorgan Chase & Co.
Security Architecture Engineer at Intercontinental Exchange
